veo3Optimization.segmentPlanning:
<8secondSingle> Complete micro-story in one unbroken segment Single clear action with beginning, middle, end No cuts needed - one continuous shot One location, one angle, one key moment </8secondSingle>
<16secondDouble> Two 8-second segments forming one story
Setup/Problem (0-8s) - establish situation Resolution/Payoff (8-16s) - deliver outcome
Plan clear cut point - change angle by 30+ degrees Segment 2 continues from segment 1's endpoint Same character, same scene, different perspective
Two-part action that naturally splits at 8-second mark </16secondDouble>
<24secondTriple> Three 8-second segments forming complete arc
Establishment (0-8s) - normal situation Complication (8-16s) - problem emerges Resolution (16-24s) - CrossFi saves the day
Three distinct camera angles/positions Each segment advances story, doesn't repeat Wide → Medium → Close OR Static → Moving → Reaction
Three-beat story that naturally breaks at 8 and 16 seconds </24secondTriple>

<8seconds> 15-20 words maximum Setup (5 words) + Reaction (10 words) Natural pauses, not rushed </8seconds>

veo3Optimization.cutPointStrategy:
Cut during natural action transitions Cut between sentences, not mid-word Cut at emotional beat changes
MANDATORY: Minimum 45-degree angle change between segments MANDATORY: Must vary between wide/medium/close across segments MANDATORY: Change POV or camera height between segments CRITICAL: Each segment MUST use different camera position/mount point
Each cut advances story, never repeats Build tension across cuts Final segment delivers maximum impact
Character and Location descriptions must be identical Specific outfit that won't change between cuts 2-3 distinctive features VEO3 can maintain Avoid complex patterns, detailed accessories Camera Style MUST vary between segments - different angles/positions
Use background elements for continuity Same props appear across segments Consistent lighting setup throughout MANDATORY: Each segment uses different camera angle/position
**CRITICAL CAMERA VARIATION RULES:** - Each segment MUST have different camera angle/position/shot size - Same character, same location, DIFFERENT camera perspective - Example fixes for your security camera scenario:
Segment 1: "Fixed security camera, high corner mount, wide angle showing full room" Segment 2: "Fixed security camera, opposite wall mount, medium shot focused on CEO area"
OR:
Segment 1: "Security camera wide shot from corner mount" Segment 2: "Security camera close-up from ceiling mount above table"
OR:
Segment 1: "High angle security camera, wide room view" Segment 2: "Low angle security camera, medium shot of CEO"
Segment 1: One camera position/angle Segment 2: DIFFERENT camera position/angle (minimum 45° change) Segment 3: THIRD unique camera position/angle
Wide establishing shot OR high angle OR specific camera mount Medium shot from different angle OR opposite side OR different height Close-up OR completely different perspective OR reaction shot

prompt.instruction:
Transform the authentic scenario into VEO3 prompts that generate viral-worthy amateur content while maintaining perfect character consistency across segments.
**CRITICAL CONSISTENCY REQUIREMENTS:** - Frame description must be IDENTICAL across all segments - Character description must be WORD-FOR-WORD identical in every prompt - Use provided consistency templates exactly - Simple character traits only (2-3 visual markers maximum)
**STYLE REQUIREMENTS:** - Choose appropriate camera type according to narrative - Include natural camera movement/shake appropriate to style - Use available lighting only or professional setup according to narrative - Natural ambient sound and authentic voice characteristics
**SPECIAL DOMAIN HANDLING:**
**For news_reports domain ONLY:** - Do NOT use identical frame descriptions across segments - Create distinct news broadcast locations: * Segment 1: Professional studio with anchor * Segment 2: Field reporter at relevant location * Segment 3: Expert interview or citizen reactions - Each segment should have different character and location - Maintain news broadcast authenticity with location changes
**For all other domains:** - Use IDENTICAL frame and character descriptions across segments - Maintain consistency as specified in standard requirements
**VEO3 PROMPT STRUCTURE (Required Order):** - **Frame:** [IDENTICAL context - use exact template wording] - **Character:** [IDENTICAL description - exact same words every time] - **Location:** [Environmental setting with consistency anchors] - **Camera Style:** [Specific amateur camera type with natural behavior] - **Action:** [Natural activity that amateur camera would capture] - **Lighting:** [Available light conditions, no professional setup] - **Mood:** [Spontaneous energy, authentic reactions] - **Dialogue:** "[Exact speech - max 20 words]" [natural voice + ambient sounds]
**INPUT DATA:** - **Original Scenario:** {scenario} - **Selected Timing:** {timing} - **Segment Breakdown:** {timing_breakdown} - **Consistency Templates:** {consistency_templates}
**REQUIRED JSON OUTPUT:** Generate production-ready VEO3 API prompts as valid JSON array:
```json [ {{ "prompt": "Frame: [IDENTICAL template]\\nCharacter: [IDENTICAL description]\\nLocation: [environmental details]\\nCamera Style: [amateur type]\\nAction: [natural activity]\\nLighting: [available light]\\nMood: [spontaneous energy]\\nDialogue: \\"[exact speech]\\" [natural voice + ambient sounds]", "aspect_ratio": "9:16", "duration": "8s", "enhance_prompt": true, "generate_audio": true }} ] ```
**VALIDATION CHECKLIST:** ✓ Frame template identical across all segments ✓ Character description word-for-word identical ✓ Camera style consistent to content ✓ Natural movement appropriate for chosen camera type ✓ Lighting setup according to narrative ✓ Dialogue under 20 words with natural delivery ✓ CrossFi integration natural and unforced ✓ Viral potential through authentic moments ✓ All technical parameters match VEO3 requirements
Generate the authentic amateur-style VEO3 prompts as valid JSON only.
